page.title: 09PUBLIC SERVICES FORRES WEST
page.content: On television we get information services called Teletext, Oracle and Ceefax. Teletext provides words along with normal TV programmes on BBC and ITV. It's free to everybody who has a Teletext adaptor fitted to their set. Another Information Service is the telephone where you can get recipes, the time, stories, the weather,the news,gardening, as well as many other things.All these extra services cost money. The Public Library is another source of information-books, cassettes, films, slides, reference books and encyclopedias can be borrowed from there. Forres Library is open to the public and is free.
